intro: Westoniella lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly westoniella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions and limited water availability. Westoniella lanuginosa is often found in rocky outcrops and coastal areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
